org.lightningj.paywall.paymenthandler.data

Interface MinimalPaymentData

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PaymentData
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FullPaymentData, PerRequestPaymentData, StandardPaymentData
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DemoFullPaymentData, DemoMinimalPaymentData, DemoPerRequestPaymentData, DemoPerRequestPaymentData

    public interface MinimalPaymentData
extends PaymentData
    Interface defining the minimal amount of information that needs to be stored for a given payment flow. Should generally only be used in test environments or proof of concepts.

    When only implementing the minimal payment data it is assumed that the order amount is the same as later invoice amount and settled amount.

    If system should support payPerRequest payments should the implementing data also implement the PerRequestPaymentData.

    See Also:
    Created by Philip Vendil on 2018-12-09.

    • Method Detail

      • getPreImageHash

        byte[] getPreImageHash()
        Unique identifier of a payment in the system and also used in LightningHandler to identify an invoice. Should be generated by TokenGenerator when creating an order and not set manually.
        Returns:
        the unique identifier of a payment.

      • setPreImageHash

        void setPreImageHash(byte[] preImageHash)
        Parameters:
        preImageHash - unique identifier of a payment in the system and also used in LightningHandler to identify an invoice. Should be generated by TokenGenerator when creating an order and not set manually.

      • getOrderAmount

        Amount getOrderAmount()
        Returns:
        the requested amount for payment. This can be either a FiatAmount or CryptoAmount but always make sure the systems configured CurrencyConverter supports this currency when converting into a currency accepted by the LightningHandler later in the payment flow.

      • setOrderAmount

        void setOrderAmount(Amount orderAmount)
        Parameters:
        orderAmount - the requested amount for payment. This can be either a FiatAmount or CryptoAmount but always make sure the systems configured CurrencyConverter supports this currency when converting into a currency accepted by the LightningHandler later in the payment flow.

      • isSettled

        boolean isSettled()
        Returns:
        true if related invoice have been settled in full.

      • setSettled

        void setSettled(boolean settled)
        Parameters:
        settled - true if related invoice have been settled in full.
